Soon XiaohuiLevel 5. GeniusAnswered on 30 May 2018Honestly speaking, there is always 2 sides to any story. ​It is okay to have no agent if everyone in your family is educated in insurance matters (claims procedures, insurance details etc) however let me give you an example on why such knowledge is important. ​Many people do thought hospital claim is simple especially with e filing system. But do you know there are scenarios which requires you to do back claim filing? This means it requires you to make payment first then you claim later. ​​Many consumers do feel frustrated if their claim is having issues especially when their love one is admitted to hospital. They may not think rational on what is the next step especially if they have issues with the bills. Or they are the one who is admitted however their love ones do not know what to do. ​Hope this helps you to understand there are scenarios which you may need additional help. WonderkidAnswered on 28 May 2018By health-related insurance, you would mean Integrated Shield Plan (ISP)? ​You will pay the same premiums even if you buy directly from online or from agents. Hence, I would suggest that you sign Integrated Shield Plan with an agent who will be there to assist with your claims should you be warded. ​Currently, I believe only NTUC Income allows you to buy ISP directly from their website. Premium-wise, I am not very sure if they charge the same as per doing it via an agent. ​If you wish to have a quotation, you can contact me via gabrielgrantt@aia.com.sg​0 comments1
